intro: Denhamia obscura, commonly known as the narrow-leaved denhamia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Denhamia obscura is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
